name: Urban Hotel Madrid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location, ultramodern hotel that is very trendy. Excellent rooftop and martini bars. Close to everything. Rooms are tiny though, food is somewhat average
reviews.title: Very cool hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Saw a review of this hotel in a national paper which described as the best in Madrid in the Designed Chic catergory - I would agree that it is a worthy winner! Spent four nights at the hotel in October 2006 and it was a lovely stay. There is a small pool and a very good roof terrace which I believe would be great during the summer months. It is ideally placed for the main sights and areas of Madrid. Would definitely recommend staying here as I cannot think of any downside to it.
reviews.title: Designer Chic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel Urban is just that! Very modern! My husband and I felt like we were in a futuristic hotel! The hotel is clean, the decour is very interesting and cool and the staff is friendly. The location is right in town so you can walk to restaurants and shops. The rooms are small but very nice. As with other hotels we stayed in in Spain there is little room to unpack. Also like other hotels in Madrid, they have nice plasma tvs, but few English channels. The pool area is on the roof and is nice, with lots of action at night. however, the prices at the pool bar change drastically depending on the time you order! And they don't let you know until your bill comes! We had some beers one evening and the first 2 cost a fraction of the second 2 simply because of the time. There is also a swanky bar in the lobby which seemed popular (we didn't go in). As for the restaurant, we only ate in the hotel for one buffet breakfast which was very good, but not worth the cost unless you eat a lot.
reviews.title: Very Cool!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I would definately recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: As stylish as it comes

likes.liked: — The pleasure of being surrounded by so much quality and fine detail
likes.disliked: — The Glass Bar was too busy and very expesnive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This wasn't a case of style over matter. It is a superb hotel in a superb position with wonderful rooms.
reviews.title: Cool Hotel

likes.disliked: — Slight noise from roof bar which is open from 10pm til 4am

reviews.title: Hotel Urban is first rate
reviews.text: We spent two nights at the Hotel Urban in April 2006, and found it to be first rate. The staff was extraordinarily helpful. The decor was hip and downright exciting (though if you prefer traditional decor, this is not the place for you). The rooms are not actually as large as they appear in the hotel web site's photos, but they are configured to make maximum use of the space, and ours was quite comfortable. Only complaint is that the lighting, though thoughtfully designed, is a bit dim for reading.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006
reviews.text: The location is excellent -- just a few blocks from both the major museums in one direction and the Plaza Major in the other. The subway is close by.
reviews.title: Urban delight
Very Swank
reviews.text: The bar serves a late breakfast from 11-12:30, which was great when we wanted to sleep in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005
reviews.text: We have just returned from a three night stay at the Hotel Urban with our two sons, aged 14 and 17. We all loved it! From the hip decor throughout to the sensational restaurant and the cool Glass Bar it doesnt disappoint in any way. It was jsut about getting warm enough to use the pool and ina few weeks time it would be wonderful to cool off there. The rooms are comfortable, with beautiful bed linen and fab bathrooms. Do try the hotel restaurant - we had a wonderful meal there.
reviews.title: Modern and good ubication

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006
reviews.text: The only down side is that it is located near the Puerto del Sol which gets very busy at night and it a bit of a zoo on a Saturday - but it doesnt really get in the way.
reviews.title: Lovely stuff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: Have just returned from staying here from Monday to Friday. I really, try as I might, have no adverse comments to make at all. The location is just superb, the staff cannot do enough for you, the rooms are comfortable and the hotel is beautifully decorated and well equipped with all you need for a city break. There is even a roof-top swimming pool that is great when you want to unwind after a day out exploring. Yes, the pool isn't enormous, but very few central hotels that are not totally unaffordable to the average person even have a pool. If you want the sort of break where you sit by a pool all day then I guess you would go to a Costa anyway. Handy tip- there is a lovely little grocery shop down the little lane on the right hand side of the hotel as you face it for juice, etc. We just loved this place and miss it already! Thank you Hotel Urban staff for making our stay such a memorable one.
reviews.title: Superb hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: This is a very comfortable and elegant hotel. It's location is fantastic. The reception staff were very helpful, especially the duty manager who went right out of his way to help arrange tickets to the Bernabeu to watch Real Madrid play Barcelona FC. Highly recommended when staying in Madrid.
reviews.title: Hotel Urban Madrid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the best hotels we have stayed at for a city break, the staff are very helpfull the rooms are maybe a tad small but when staying in a city like this the size of your is not the be all and end all, the only thing missing from the room which you would get from most 5 star hotels would be tea and coffee in the room. The roof terrace is a great place to be after a long day seeing the sights or Madrid with a small but very refreshing pool (not heated) this place really comes alive after dark with a great atmosphere. Breakfast was not included in the price but we were offered a deal for 15 euros per person per day, but we had breakfast with the locals in a coffee shop 2 mins walk away
reviews.title: Great hotel great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a 3 night trip & I can't rate this hotel highly enough. We booked the duplex room, but this wasn't ready so we were upgraded to a junior suite which was beautiful room with spa bath & great decor etc
reviews.title: Loved this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only reason I didn't give this an excellent rating is there were a couple of small issues. We had a drink in the glass bar on our first night & to be charged 28 euro's for two drinks I thought was bit excessive.
reviews.title: loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006
reviews.text: Hotel lobby and rooftop facilities were beautiful. Location was great. Desk staff was indifferent, restaurant and beverage prices were pretty steep and when I checked in, they had a much smaller room than requested. Would I stay here again? Probably not. I'd spend my money on a hotel with a friendlier and more helpful staff.
reviews.title: Just Okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from the Hotel Urban two days ago, and it was a fabulous way to end a 2-week trip to Spain.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very cool--definitely up to the standards of my hometown of New York. I'm not sure if I agree with others about the smiling faces of the doormen on your arrival. Our doorman was professional but gruff. And our bellman, clad in head-to-toe black, spent as much time posing as carting bags. But the reception staff is excellent, very welcoming, very helpful.
reviews.title: Urban Oasis...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The lobby area is super cool, with glass elevators, backlit alabaster, a towering atrium. The rooms are small, as I expected, but gorgeous. They're chic, dark wood-paneled boxes. Once I figured out how to stow our suitcases in the closet, I cleared out some floorspace and we really took to the place. The lighting is complicated at first, but fabulous and dramatic. The bathrooms are also fantastic and luxurious. After our first turn-down service, their was a half bottle of red wine on the desk with the manager's card--a nice touch. Service is quick--for more towels, or to fix the TV.
reviews.title: chic but crazy drink prices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had a tapas lunch in the Glass Bar our first afternoon. It was excellent but expensive, but that's to be expected at a top hotel in a top tier city. It had a Japanese influence, which was very welcome after 2 weeks of jamon, jamon, jamon! The glasses of wine they served were miniscule--which frankly they could improve upon for the price.
reviews.title: Fantastic (and fancy) place in a great location, a little bit on the pricy side

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Urban is a great place to stay. From the minute you enter the front door, you are greeted by at least 2 people with smiling faces. The hotel's decor can be described as modern minimalist with a dash of zen. Although the rooms are small by American standards, the furnishings, the color schemes, the art pieces, the LCD tv plus the floor to ceiling windows with automatic drapes make you feel like you're at a mini suite at the Palms in Vegas. The vibe of the whole hotel is young, chic and hip. The club music that's filtered through speakers around the entire hotel is a nice touch that makes one feel energized in the morning. The breakfast buffet at the hotel is good although the small selection can get old. Getting around town from the hotel is a snap as this hotel is within walking distance to the main plaza's and the museums. To and from the airport is a snap, just take a cab. Its a 20 minute drive that will set you back around $20 plus tip.
reviews.title: Modern chic in historic Madrid

likes.liked: — Hotel and room furnishings and decorations.
likes.disliked: — Rooms are small by American standards.

reviews.title: tiny closet
reviews.text: our first room had a 'closet' that could only hold 2 suits and nothing else, and we were booked for 3 nights. Barely room for our 2 suitcases in the enitre room. After complaining we were given a different room (begrudingly), and told the 'hotel is full.' At breakfast that was OK, we quickly learned that an egg white omelet was not their forte. I will say that the location was fine for thyssen museum and prado and an easy walk to plaza del sol. we asked for a rate sheet and told the rates changed every day depending on occupancy. so much for this place.

reviews.title: Loved the Urban
reviews.text: We stayed at the Urban for 3 nights from 24th May. The rooms are small but very high tech and the service is excellent. The highlight of the hotel has to be the roof terrace, there is a bar and a very small pool (more like a paddling pool than a swimming pool) with sun loungers and big bean bags. There is seating areas all around the roof with a mixture of sun loungers, bar tables and stools and plastic sofas. There is also a great bar on the ground floor. The location of the hotel is also great with lots of restaurants and attractions in walking distance.

reviews.title: Up on the Roof!!
reviews.text: The Hotel Urban is without doubt a first class hotel. As mentioned in other reviews the rooms are on the small size for the rate, but with the amazing weather we enjoyed the rooftop terrace and pool (paddling pool) more than made up for this. The service was great, but as a young gay couple we did sometimes get inquisitive looks - not because we were gay, but because we were young and not dressed as formally as some of the other guests i feel. On the whole though a great stay, very central and absolutely immaculate. Make sure you spend the late afternoon with a bottle of wine lounging on the roof!!

reviews.title: Small and perfectly formed
reviews.text: Great hotel - ok the rooms aren't the biggest you will stay in but they are well thought out and high quality. Staff are very helpful, the food good and great cocktails. Best thing however was the roof terrace - be sure to use it most people don't seem to - more fool them. Recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: I had a great stay at the Urban after staying at another beautiful boutique hotel in Barcelona, that's part of the same hotel group as well as Small Luxury Hotels of the World!
reviews.title: Best choice for location and hotel quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As others have pointed out, the Urban is in a great location --- centrally located to museums as well as other sights. The facilities are top notch and the service is very warm and friendly.
reviews.title: Great Location, Let down by Ammenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you like a modern hotel with style and quality, in the best location, I highly recommend the Urban!
reviews.title: Superbly-located urban oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The location of this hotel is great. The major museums are walking distance. The staff are very friendly and professional. The rooms are sufficient in size and very clean. The interior design of the rooms is too dark but is this a matter of choice. If you get museum fatigue visit the the Jeronimos park close to the hotel.
reviews.title: excellent hotel, service and facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Being a boutique hotel there is the usual lack of ammenities. The gym was clearly an afterthought for this design hotel. Better off running in the park...
reviews.title: excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we booked a long weekend away to Madrid and chose this Hotel based on facilities and location...and we were not disappointed. It is smaller than it looks on the website and has therefore an elite feel. Location is fabulous within a stone throw of Plaza Ana and many of the main attractions. We were treated to complimentary champagne in the Glass Bar on arrival and we had dinner in the roof top restaurant which rivals many Michelin starred restaurants, afterwards enjoying the vibe in the uber trendy roof bar. Our room was lovely with all mod cons, good storage and we would definitely stay there again. If you want to eat in restaurant, book in advance as very popular, you can do this by e-mail.
reviews.title: Trendy, Boutique, exclusive...all describe this Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: This is my second stay at Hotel Urban and I loved it each time! The first time I stayed in a small, but very comfortable room. The second time I had a large room, with a beautiful bathroom with separate tub and shower. The bathrooms were luxurious and large in both rooms. The decor is very modern and stylish as is the beautiful lobby. The staff were very helpful with suggestions and directions. The location is perfect......the Prado, Reina Sofia, Thyssen, Retiro Park, Pureta del sol, Plaza Mayor, the Royal Palace, Gran Via, Mercado San Miguel, Atocha Station, Chueca, La Latina and Salamanca districts are all no more than a 15-20 minute walk from the hotel. Madrid is a fascinating city and side trips to Toledo, Segovia and El Escorial are definitely worth your time. When I return to Madrid I wll absolutely stay at the Hotel Urban.
reviews.title: Modern Boutique Hotel in Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hubby and I spent 4 nights at this really nice hotel. Reception on arrival was excellent and that customer received from all staff during our stay was at the top of the list for the great things about this hotel. Good size room ( not large but adequate) Very quiet room overlooking the small lane to the side of the hotel and with the blackout blinds did mean we slept late every day. Bed comfort OK ( though beds in Spain are always very hard) large bath tub and great shower. I agree with another poster that mentioned things getting a little tired, creaking wooden floors and furniture showing signs of age, fixtures & fittings not quite up to 5* standards, though some nice little touches , Bathrobes slippers, fresh single red roses etc. The Interior design of the hotel is fabulous , I loved the Arc deco/ modern theme with the Asian artifacts spread throughout the residence. We did not make use of the lower restaurant but used both bars at the hotel. Again excellent service at both, ( terrace bar very slow with food orders) The young barman at the Glass Bar ( short yellow hair) was just wonderful,, made us feel special though of course is his job will have done this for all is customers. The pool is nice though impossible to get lounger by the pool, just 5 loungers in total at the pool, so of course it was going to be difficult, ( particularly when you read the previous post of guest putting towels and sunscreen to “reserve” their loungers) , no matter we did manage to grab a lounger on a couple of occasion up on the terrace , a little way off from the pool. All in all a really lovely hotel though I would dispute its 5* rating, not because of anything negative just not quite up to the grade. I loved Madrid , a truly stunning city and would ( will ) return to this hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel ,,, though maybe not 5*

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: place was very nice, service staff was very helpful specially the bell support (Robert). Only area i thought was negative was drinks at the hotel were very pricey. I would go back and stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Quick get away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Normally I like to weigh up reviews giving good and bad comments but, to be honest, you'd be hard pushed to say bad things about this place.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel
Great location and value
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel at recommendation of guide book. Great design and attention to detail throughout entire hotel. Liked it so much I just booked at the Hotel Claris (another Derby Hotel) tomorrow for a couple of nights while in Barcelona.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positives
reviews.title: great location, great looking hotel - with rooftop pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location - really central, makes it easy to walk to most things. check out Marcado San Migeul near Plaza Mayor
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Look of hotel - very modern
reviews.title: This hotel is very cool. Perfect location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pool - although small its really handy having an outdoor pool in this very hot city! Its on the rooftop and turns into a cool bar area at night. Only 4 loungers on the sunny side though and I think it closes in low season
reviews.title: Cool and great location

description: A grand luxury five-star hotel located in the very heart of Madrid, in the museum triangle formed by the Museo del Prado, the Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum and the Queen Sofia Foundation and just a few minutes away from Paseo del Prado, Puerta del Sol and El Retiro park.Located in a newly constructed building in the heart of the financial, political, commercial and cultural centre of Madrid, the Hotel Urban won't fail to catch your interest.With a marked Art-Deco style and opting for avant-garde architecture, the Hotel Urban is a boutique hotel from the 21st century, urban, design and ideal for exacting lovers of luxury who shy from conventionality. A charming, modern design hotel that has already become a point of reference. It stands out not only in the hotel panorama but also among Madrid's dining establishments and nighttime entertainment venues thanks to Europa Decó and the Glass Bar.Services102 guest rooms: 78 superior rooms, 10 junior suite duplex, 5 junior suites, 8 suites, and 1 duplex loft suiteEuropa Decó gastronomic restaurantGlass Bar oyster barLa Terraza del Urban cocktail barEl Cielo del UrbanBreakfast buffetBreakfast until 1.00 pm24-hour room service and mini-barWi-Fi in all areasBusiness centreFunction rooms and spaces for events: Nagha room, Khemer room, Nefer room, Egyptian Museum, lobby/atrium, terrace-pool and suite 132Outdoor swimming pool and solariumGymEgyptian MuseumCollection of ancient artParkingLaundry and ironing serviceDisabled accessSmall dogs allowed
